ca.cgjennings.imageio

Class ImageWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.imageio.ImageWriter

  • public class ImageWriter
extends Object
    A ImageWriter consists of a file format and some simple metadata and output parameters. Once initialized, an ImageWriter can be used to write RenderedImage images with less hassle than working with javax.imageio.

    Use pattern:
    Create an ImageWriter using the file format you wish to write images in (create multiple instances for multiple formats). For each image you wish to write, call the appropriate set methods to set the metadata and output parameters, then call one of the write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, java.io.File)methods to write the image with the requested settings (or as close as can be obtained).

    Note:
    it is important to dispose() of instances of this class when finished with them, as many of the underlying encoders consume significant native resources.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageWriter

        public ImageWriter(String fileFormat)
        A convenience constructor that calls ImageWriter(String,Locale) using the system default locale returned by Locale.getDefault().

      • ImageWriter

        public ImageWriter(String fileFormat,
                   Locale locale)
        Create a ImageWriter that will produce images in the format specified by fileFormat. The fileFormat parameter can be any format name registered with the javax.imageio library. The standard supported formats are JPG, PNG, WBMP, BMP, and GIF.

        The locale specifies a locale to use for localizing messages. In particular, the descriptions returned by getCompressionQualityDescriptions() will be in the requested locale if possible. Other messages may also use the locale information. If the requested locale is unavailable, a default locale will be selected instead.

        Parameters:
        fileFormat - name of file format to be produced by this writer
        locale - the locale
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if fileFormat is not a known type.

    • Method Detail

      • createImageWriterForFormat

        public static ImageWriter createImageWriterForFormat(String format,
                                                     Locale loc)
        Creates an ImageIO writer for the requested format.
        Parameters:
        format - the format to create a writer for
        loc - the ideal locale for the writer
        Returns:
        an image writer for the locale

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Causes resources used by this writer to be released, including native resources. The result of calling any method of this writer after calling dispose() is undefined (although the typical result would be a NullPointerException).

      • getComment

        public String getComment()
        Return the comment to be embedded in files written by this writer, if possible. If no comment has been set, returns null.
        Returns:
        the currently set comment, or null if there is no comment

      • getCompressionQuality

        public float getCompressionQuality()
        Return the current compression quality setting. A value between 0 and 1 indicates a relative compression value with 0 representing maximum compression. If the format does not support compression, or if a default compression setting has been requested, the value -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the relative compression level, or -1 for default or no compression

      • getCompressionQualityDescriptions

        public String[] getCompressionQualityDescriptions()
        Return an array of locale-dependent descriptions of the availble compression quality settings. This method may return null, and must return null if getCompressionValues() does.
        Returns:
        an array of description Strings, or null if there are descriptions available
        See Also:
        getCompressionValues()

      • getCompressionValues

        public float[] getCompressionValues()
        Return an array of quality values indicating the ranges of compression qualities covered by the strings returned by getCompressionValues(). The quality setting getCompressionQualities()[i] covers all compression settings from getCompressionValues()[i], inclusive, to getCompressionValues()[i+1], exclusive. The only exception is for i == getCompressionQualities().length - 1, which includes the final value in the range.
        Returns:
        an array of description Strings, or null if there are descriptions available

      • getFormat

        public String getFormat()
        Get the name of the file format this instance will writeRenderedImage files in.
        Returns:
        the file format specified at construction

      • getLocale

        public Locale getLocale()
        Get the locale used to localize message strings. The locale is used when the array of quality strings is requested, and may also be used for other messages (such as exceptions).
        Returns:
        the currently used locale

      • getPixelsPerInch

        public float getPixelsPerInch()
        Return the resolution to be written with images, in pixels per inch.

      • getPixelsPerMillimetre

        public float getPixelsPerMillimetre()
        Return the resolution to be written with images, in pixels per mm. As a convenience, getPixelsPerInch() is also provided. Images written with the writer will specify a horizontal and vertical resolution as close to this value as the file format allows.
        Returns:
        the current image resolution to use for writing, pixels per mm
        See Also:
        getPixelsPerInch()

      • getProgressiveScan

        public boolean getProgressiveScan()
        Return the current progressive scan setting. If the format does not support progressive scans, the method always returns false.
        Returns:
        true if progressive scans are supported and enabled

      • isLossless

        public boolean isLossless()
        Return true if the format's compression method is lossless. A lossless format does not degrade in quality when written. If the selected format is uncompressed, this method always returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the selected format does not lose information

      • isProgressiveScanSupported

        public boolean isProgressiveScanSupported()
        Return true if this format supports writing progressive scan images.
        Returns:
        true if setProgressiveScan(true) is obeyed

      • selectCompressionType

        protected String selectCompressionType(String[] types)
        This method is called by ImageWriter when a format supports multiple types of compression and it must choose one of them. The array types is always a valid array of names of compression types. The implementation in ImageWriter returns a default compression type selected from the array.

        Subclasses may override this method if they wish to select a specific compression method as the default for a particular format.

      • setComment

        public void setComment(String comment)
        Set the comment text that will be written along with files created by this writer. If comment is null, the current comment is cleared. The comment will be assumed to be written in the language specified by this writer's locale.
        Parameters:
        comment - the comment text to be included in the file's metadata.

      • setComment

        public void setComment(String comment,
                       Locale commentLocale)
        Set the comment text that will be written along with files created by this writer. If comment is null, the current comment (if any) is cleared.
        Parameters:
        comment - the comment text to be included in the file's metadata.
        commentLocale - a locale describing the language the comment is written in

      • setCompressionQuality

        public void setCompressionQuality(float quality)
        Control the compression quality during image writing. If quality is between 0 and 1 (inclusive), then a relative quality is requested, with a value of 0 emphasizing maximum compression and a value of 1 requesting maximum image quality. (If the format is lossless, then image quality is not affected.) If quality is less than 0, then a default compression level will be selected. If quality is greater than 1, the the writer will use no compression if possible. If the format only supports compressed data, then maximum image quality will be selected instead.
        Parameters:
        quality - the relative quality (0-1), or a value requesting default (<0) or no compression (>1)

      • setCompressionQuality

        public void setCompressionQuality(String description)
        Set image compression according to one of the strings returned by getCompressionQualityDescriptions(). The compression level will be set to the midpoint of the the description's value range.
        Parameters:
        description - the quality description string matching the desired quality level
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if description is not a valid quality description
        See Also:
        getCompressionQualityDescriptions()

      • setPixelsPerInch

        public void setPixelsPerInch(float ppi)
        Set the pixels-per-inch resolution that will be written with the file's metadata, if possible. The default resolution is 72 pixels per inch.

      • setPixelsPerMillimetre

        public void setPixelsPerMillimetre(float ppmm)
        Set image resolution that will be written with the file's metadata, if possible. The resolution is specified in pixels per millimetre. As a convenience, setPixelsPerInch(float) is also provided.

        The default resolution is 72 pixels per inch (approximately 2.8 pixels per mm). Images written with the writer will specify a horizontal and vertical resolution as close to this value as the file format allows.

        Parameters:
        ppmm - the intended image resolution, in pixels per mm
        See Also:
        setPixelsPerInch(float)

      • setProgressiveScan

        public void setProgressiveScan(boolean useProgressiveScanIfPossible)
        Request that the writer use progressive scans, if possible. When true and supported by the format, images are written in a series of scans of increasing quality.
        Parameters:
        useProgressiveScanIfPossible - if true, the writer will writeRenderedImage images progressively if the format supports it

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Description copied from class: java.lang.Object
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.

      • write

        public void write(Image im,
                  ImageOutputStream ios)
           throws IOException
        Writes the image im to an ImageOutputStream. The stream is left open after writing. A copy of the image will be created in a suitable format if it is not a RenderedImage.
        Parameters:
        im - the Image to be written
        ios - the ImageOutputStream to write the image to
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur during the write operation

      • write

        public void write(Image im,
                  OutputStream out)
           throws IOException
        Writes the image im to an output stream. The stream is left open after writing.
        Parameters:
        im - the Image to be written
        out - the OutputStream to writeRenderedImage to
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur during the write operation

      • write

        public void write(RenderedImage im,
                  File output)
           throws IOException
        Writes the image im to a file, creating the intermediate stream and closing it on completion. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        im - an Image to be written
        output - the File which contains the destination file to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur during the write operation

      • writeCompatible

        public void writeCompatible(Image im,
                            File output)
                     throws IOException
        Writes the image im to a file, creating the intermediate stream and closing it on completion. If the file exists, it will be overwritten. A rendered image will be created for the image data, if necessary.
        Parameters:
        im - an Image to be written
        output - the File which contains the destination file to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur during the write operation
